text.section:
Except as provided in subsections (b) and (c) of this section, within 90 days after receiving an application for a development permit for a qualifying redevelopment project, the county shall:
approve or disapprove the application; and
notify the applicant of the approval or disapproval in writing.

The county shall have an additional 60 days to comply with subsection (a) of this section if:
a county unit involved in the review of the application determines that the extension is necessary to complete the review based on:
the nature or complexity of the application; or
unresolved issues related to the application; and
the county unit notifies the applicant about the extension in writing; or
the applicant modifies the application for any reason, including for the purpose of responding to a request from a county unit that is involved in the review of the application; and
the modification is made during the original 90-day period under subsection (a) of this section.

In addition to the 60-day extension provided under subsection (b) of this section, the county shall have an additional 30 days to comply with subsection (a) of this section if:
the applicant modifies the application for any reason, including for the purpose of responding to a request from a county unit that is involved in the review of the application; and
the modification is made during the 60-day extension under subsection (b) of this section.
